page.title: 17Home Life at Beaumont
page.content: In the Beaumont area{Home Baking was undertaken in most homes, but only 25% ate home-baked bread. {Vegetables}were grown by 74% of homes, but only 36% were completely self-supporting. {Eating out}was enjoyed regularly by 22%, whilst 60% ate out occassionally. {Annual holidays}were taken by 92% of people. 16% holidayed abroad, 60% stayed in Britain, and 16% went to relatives. 50% of homes have a{telephone installed, and the area has only three call boxes. There are{no shops}in the area, but {Travelling Vans}sell fruit & vegetables, bread & cakes and fish. Most homes have a{pet.}Dogs 49% : Cats 31% : Caged Birds 5% : Others 21%.
